project.teaser: SEAMLESS aims at developing and adapting missing building blocks and enablers into a fully automated, economically viable, cost-effective, and resilient waterborne freight feeder loop service for Short Sea Shipping (SSS) and/or Inland Waterways Transport (IWT). Autonomous...
project.objective: SEAMLESS aims at developing and adapting missing building blocks and enablers into a fully automated, economically viable, cost-effective, and resilient waterborne freight feeder loop service for Short Sea Shipping (SSS) and/or Inland Waterways Transport (IWT). Autonomous systems will be integrated to ensure safe, resilient, efficient, and environmentally friendly operation to shift road freight movements to hinterland waterways, while enhancing the performance of the TEN-T network. The service will be delivered 24/7 by a fleet of autonomous cargo shuttles, with humans-in-the-loop located in Remote Operation Centres (ROCs), which efficiently cooperate with automated and autonomous shore-side infrastructure and safely interact with conventional systems. The services will rely on a redesigned logistics system enabling seamless freight flows by minimising delays at intermodal nodes. A digital bird’s eye view of the supply chain allows the exploitation of real-time information for planning optimisation and reconfiguration to support resilient logistics, incl. digitalised administrative procedures. The SEAMLESS building blocks will be verified and validated by conducting full-scale demonstrations in selected real-world scenarios. Transferability will be fully demonstrated in selected use cases that cover a wide range of transport applications and geographical regions throughout Europe. Based on a structured methodological framework evaluating sustainability criteria, they will act as guidance for the replication of the project results beyond the project scope and timespan. Novel business models will be thus developed and provide a framework for implementing the SEAMLESS service to minimise investment risk for first movers. Regulatory gaps and challenges related to autonomous vessel operation (e.g. social aspects) will be identified, and recommendations for policy makers to allow the smooth and safe deployment of fully automated services will be provided.
project.title: Safe, Efficient and Autonomous: Multimodal Library of European Shortsea and inland Solutions
project.keywords: Autonomous waterborne transport, Galileo services, sustainable business models, synchromodal logistics, modal shift, IWT and SSS, feeder loop service, zero-emission autonomous vessels, innovative port

article.title: A closer look at short sea shipping

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable will provide the plan for presenting all data types that the project intends to collate, and the necessary approvals needed from national data protection authorities. It will contain the Data Protection Certificates. It will be updated in M18 of the project to present how such adherence has benefited the project implementation as well as the challenges faced and recommendations for related projects.

webItem.alternativeText: The SEAMLESS Use Cases cover a broad area, striving for Paneuropean excellence and impact

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project Administrative and Financial Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable will provide a comprehensive Project Management Plan and the detailed procedures that will be used by the Consortium for: 1) coordinating the Consortium members, 2) communicating project results and issues to the EC, and 3) managing financial issues.

result.title: Project logo and set of public document templates
result.description: This deliverable will provide the project logo and outline the projects public document templates.

result.title: State-of-the-art and baseline for the SEAMLESS Use Cases
result.description: This deliverable will provide the baseline for the SEAMLESS use cases, including the state of the art, and stakeholder analysis.

result.title: Data Management Plan - Rev 1
result.description: This deliverable will provide the plan for presenting all data types that the project intends to collate, and the necessary approvals needed from national data protection authorities. It will contain the Data Protection Certificates. It will be updated in M36 of the project to present how such adherence has benefited the project implementation as well as the challenges faced and recommendations for related projects.

result.title: Outlook on Key Performance Indicators for use cases
result.description: This deliverable will describe the KPIs that will form the basis upon which the impact of the SEAMLESS Building Blocks will be evaluated.

result.title: Project Quality and Risk Management
result.description: This deliverable will provide the detailed procedures that will be used by the Consortium for assuring high quality work and effective risk management as well as define quality KPIs that the project should meet by its completion.

result.title: ModalNET Specifications, systems architecture, and design of cyber-secure communication
result.description: This deliverable will provide the requirements, technical specifications, and architecture of the integrated supply chain support system (ModalNET). It also includes the system architecture that will facilitate secure communication between the various physical assets.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
